newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya closes two currency dealers.
newsitem.headline: Kenya closes two currency dealers.

text.p: The Central Bank of Kenya said on Wednesday it had ordered two currency dealing houses, Asia Fx PTE and Afro-Asian Commodities, to close and to apply for banking licences because they were conducting banking business.

"We asked them to close down because we found they were conducting banking business -- accepting deposits, which they were calling margins -- without a banking licence," Reuben Marambii, chief banking director told Reuters.
The companies were engaged in speculative foreign exchange dealing and required an initial minimum deposit of $20,000 from investors to trade in international markets, he added.
Under Kenyan law, any deposits placed with an institution not licenced as a bank by the central bank are not protected.

"They have been in a no man's world," Marambii said, referring to the fact that they did not fall under the jurisdiction of the Capital Markets Authority nor the central bank, which made it difficult for the bank to supervise them.
